document: Chapter 1: Data Science in a Big Data World - Fundamentals of Data Science

questions.question: Data science is an evolutionary extension of statistics that can handle massive amounts of data.
The main difference between data scientists and statisticians is that statisticians work with big data.
Big data is defined by three Vs: Volume, Variety, and Velocity.
RDBMS (relational database management systems) are ideal for handling all types of big data.
Data science is only used in commercial settings, not in noncommercial ones.
Governmental organizations never share their data with the public.
MOOCs (massive open online courses) do not produce significant amounts of data.
Structured data resides in fixed fields within records and is easy to store in tables.
Unstructured data is always easy to fit into a data model.
Natural language processing has achieved perfect understanding of all text.
Machine-generated data is created without human intervention.
Graph-based data focuses on the relationship or adjacency of objects.
Tasks like recognizing objects in pictures are easy for computers but difficult for humans.
Streaming data flows into the system in batches rather than when events happen.
The data science process typically consists of six steps.
Distributed file systems can only store files smaller than a single computer disk.
HDFS (Hadoop File System) is a closed-source distributed file system.
In distributed systems, you move your data to your program rather than moving your program to the data.
Data integration frameworks are similar to ETL processes in traditional data warehouses.
Machine learning frameworks are used to extract insights from data.
NoSQL stands for 'No SQL' meaning these databases don't use SQL at all.
Traditional relational databases can easily handle streaming, graph, and unstructured data.
Data scientists need experience in machine learning, computing, and algorithm building.
Volume refers to how diverse different types of data are.
NGOs (non-governmental organizations) do not use data science.
Structured data is typically managed using SQL.
Email is an example of structured data because it has sender, title, and body fields.
Web server logs are an example of machine-generated data.
Graph theory uses nodes, edges, and properties to represent graphical data.
DeepMind created an algorithm that learns to play video games by taking video screen as input.
The 'What's trending' on Twitter is an example of streaming data.
Distributed file systems automatically replicate files across multiple servers.
HDFS is an implementation of the Microsoft File System.
The big data ecosystem includes technologies with similar goals and functionalities.
NoSQL databases cannot scale beyond a single node.
Data science adds methods from computer science to the repertoire of statistics.
Velocity in big data refers to how much data there is.
Commercial companies use data science mainly for customer insights and personalization.
Natural language is a type of structured data.
Graph-based data is a natural way to represent social networks.
